channel.title: Chapter 17: Nonlinear Support Vector Machines on Introduction to Machine Learning (I2ML)
channel.description: Recent content in Chapter 17: Nonlinear Support Vector Machines on Introduction to Machine Learning (I2ML)

item.title: Chapter 17.01: Feature Generation for Nonlinear Separation
item.description: We show how nonlinear feature maps project the input data to transformed spaces, where they become linearly separable.

item.title: Chapter 17.02: The Kernel Trick
item.description: In this section, we show how nonlinear SVMs work their magic by introducing nonlinearity efficiently via the kernel trick.

item.title: Chapter 17.03: The Polynomial Kernel
item.description: In this section, we introduce the polynomial kernel in the context of SVMs and demonstrate how different polynomial degrees affect decision boundaries.

item.title: Chapter 17.04: Reproducing Kernel Hilbert Space and Representer Theorem
item.description: In this section, we introduce important theoretical background on nonlinear SVMs that essentially allows us to express them as a weighted sum of basis functions.

item.title: Chapter 17.05: The Gaussian RBF Kernel
item.description: In this section, we introduce the popular Gaussian RBF kernel and discuss its properties.

item.title: Chapter 17.06: SVM Model Selection
item.description: In this section, we discuss the importance of SVM hyperparameters for adequate solutions.
